properties.address: Ashfield Health & Wellbeing Centre, Nottinghamshire NG17 7AE
properties.description: Ashfield Voluntary Action invites you to our Warm Welcome Activity Space. Social Groups run throughout the week and adults are welcome to join us. When the group ends our Warm Welcome doesn't. You can stay until 4pm and make use of the games, puzzles, and crafts or pick up a book and have a quiet read. The hot drinks trolley will be available for you to use. Bring some lunch with you or pop down to our kiosk in the main reception that offers hot and cold food at reasonable prices. For more information about our social groups please call 01623 555 551 or visit our website www.ashfieldvoluntaryaction.org.uk Please note we are unable to offer this service from Friday 22nd December 2023 until Monday 8th January 2024
properties.title: AVA Warm Welcome Activity Space

properties.address: Christchurch Cotmanhay and Shipley Church Hall, Derbyshire DE7 8QL
properties.description: Warm, welcoming and accessible, open to all. Starting on 7th November 2023 on Tuesdays from 12noon - 3pm Note: no group on 14th November, back on 21st November. Hot food, unlimited tea and coffee.

properties.description: Experience the power of kindness! Our friendly team makes sure every visit is filled with smiles, warmth, and genuine care. Our team is here to guide our visitors, providing referrals to other essential services.

properties.address: Spondon Community Library, Derbyshire DE21 7FG
properties.description: Derby Libraries will be providing warm spaces with extra seating and free hot drinks to support communities with the cost of living this winter. The spaces will be available to all to relax and connect in a safe, warm, welcoming space. Library staff will be on hand to support people who want to join the library and borrow books as well as sign post people to support and trusted information on the cost of living. There will also be opportunities for people to access a busy regular programme of free activities in the libraries from family rhymetimes to adult book groups. To protect the planet and reduce the use of plastic people are encouraged to bring their own cups into libraries. Everyone is welcome to unlimited refills of tea and coffee. Hot drinks will be available Fridays 10am - 1pm
properties.title: Spondon Community Library

hours._text: Tuesday and Thursday morning 9am to 12 noon

properties.title: Men in Sheds Carlton

properties.address: The Stores Building, The Stores Building, Nottingham Road, Daybrook, Nottingham, NG5 6LU
properties.description:
£3 per session. Men in Sheds supports older men in search of a hobby and those who want to socialise, share and learn new skills all in the welcoming setting of a workshop.
Equipment and tools are provided and volunteers are there for support. Members take part in the day-to-day running of the shed and decide on activities they want to follow including woodworking, skills sharing and socialising.

hours._text:
Mon - Thurs, 9.00am – 3:30pm (One morning session 9.00am – 12pm / 12.30 – 3.30pm) 

Thursdays are a mixed session for women and men over 50.
